metadata.Title: CVE-2019-10161 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
It was discovered that libvirtd before versions 4.10.1 and 5.4.1 would permit read-only clients to use the virDomainSaveImageGetXMLDesc() API, specifying an arbitrary path which would be accessed with the permissions of the libvirtd process. An attacker with access to the libvirtd socket could use this to probe the existence of arbitrary files, cause denial of service or cause libvirtd to execute arbitrary programs.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-10161` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-bin - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-clients - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-daemon - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-sheepdog - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-daemon-system - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-sanlock - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt-wireshark - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
libvirt0 - 4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.0-1ubuntu8.12').
